name: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol
Reason: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol has a melting point that we can compare to by analyzing its structural components: (1) The basic unit for our comparison will be 2-methoxyphenol, which has a melting point of around 20 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 2-[(E)-2-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol will affect its melting point: (1) The methoxy group (Oc1c(cc(cc1OC)C)C=Cc2ccc(O)c(OC)c2) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +5°C. (2) The hydroxy group (4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl) adds approximately +10°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. (3) The vinyl group (C=Cc2ccc(O)c(OC)c2) introduces a rigid structure, estimated at around +5°C. (4) The methyl group (4-methyl) adds approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces.
